instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: Purchased unit at the suggestion of CISCO sales rep after inquiry on home network set up and getting my CISCO wireless router to cover the whole house.  Set up was a bit long and required paying CISCO a fee to get all my devices up and running [had a Wireless CISCO 310 that was outshide warranty period and had to pay a fee to get it set up on this router]  Long story short - unit worked well when it worked but had frequent loss of connectivity and required re-set each time.  Finally got on phone with CISCO tech support and tried to fix.  Inexperienced tech on phone flashed unit, but was unable to get it to work again - two hours later on phone, he gave up and offerred replacement, via paid RMA to/from [$30+ ship to get it replaced] - no empathy on his error - just put me on hold for the next custoemr service rep to process RMA. His last comment was \\"this is not the right unit for your house - you need to upgrade\\"  End of day - paid more than the original cost to set it up and return the bad unit back   Just sharing ...

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: I just got this drive @ Fry's today and it really has issues. I have Seagate 300GB SATA right now and I bought this 400GB as replacement. Running Vista Ultimate w/ all updates, it can't be detected. I uninstalled 300GB drive and fresh installed OS on 400GB drive and it worked (took a while though. I tried seagate disk wizard to clone 300GB to 400 GB drive and errors....can't read data on disk 2(SG 400GB SATA). Physically, the st3400633as(400GB) is scorching hot compared to the Seagate 300GB SATA I am replacing. I thought maybe I got a defective unit that's why I'm on this site now, to check for other user's expirience. And found someone w/ same expirience. I'm returning it.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: Is it leather?   No. Does it do the job?   Yes. Have I had issues with it sliding out of the sleeve?  No.    Upon receiving it, I marked the spot for the light sensor. Using a paper hole punch, I made a perfectly round hole. Then I used a lighter to seal the edge around the hole. No fraying and no separating.    Don't buy it expecting high quality leather. But, if you're like me, and just spent $500 on your iPad, and want to protect it temporarily without breaking the bank, this is definitely the case for you.    I do intend to get something better down the road, but for right now, this is an excellent, inexpensive option.

Outstanding design, worth every penny. Thank you Logitech.

I will give it five stars now, only because I do not know how long it will remain this good. After market batteries have a tendency to hit end-of-life before most OEMs. If it starts to drop off on run-times, I will update.

Good purchase so far though.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
I had been a Patriot Memory fan, thinking they made great quality mem. I was wrong. I had thoroughly tested the Extreme Performance card and found it ran well under 60x on USB 2.0 xfers to my puter, it specs at 133x.

On my Ex Perf 2GB sD card, the lock fell OUT after somehow locking first. I never did get my card unlocked and couldn't retrieve the over 400+ pics I had shot to it. If you want to read how bad cust. svc can get, read on... read on...

9/14/2006 I called and spoke to DL, he needed pics of card and e-mail, so I sent to him... along w/ name, part #, etc.

9/25/2006 I get response from CG, that RMA is accepted and DL will contact me to give me RMA #.

Between 9/25-11/17 I contact Patriot about 4 times and can't anywhere: \\"I'll need your RMA number\\" I don't have one, I'm trying to get one. \\"Then you'll need to talk to RMA dept.\\" I NEED to speak to DL or CG... \\"If you don't have an RMA you'll need to RMA dept...

11/17/2006 I reach CG on phone. I send her long e-mail (cc: DL) saying this never processed, DL didn't issue RMA. I put name, addy, phone, part number on e-mail requesting RMA.

CG fwds e-mail to DL. Here's DL's e-mail response: \\"Can you tell me the RMA # so I can have RMA dept. look into this for you.\\"

My response (ALL CAPS and BOLD): I don't have one, I'm awaiting RMA # from you. I included a suggestion he should actually read the message he responded to and such...

DL's response: I will need some information to start, name, addy, phone, part #... Once I have I will start the process of an RMA for you...

My response (ALL CAPS, BOLD and RED... plus I included threads to EVERY e-mail to date): You've got to be kidding me... I've included all this in every e-mail already today.

Now I call Patriot. I ask to speak to RMA supervisor, to find out DL is ABOVE the RMA supervisor! So I ask for the President... I actually get a VP (Ithink?), LH. I send him 4 e-mails, each with threads and responses.

LH: this isn't how we want to do business. Send to my attention I'll make sure you're taking good care of for your troubles.

I ask if after 3 months of hassles he'd consider upgrading me to a 4GB card. He says he'll take good care of me.

12/21 I get a (new? I don't know) 2GB card in the mail with no apology, NO UPC for future warranty, just a card in a clear plastic sD case. I paid $80 for my original 2GB PatMem Ex Perf card 9 months ago... 14 weeks! Over three months to RMA, lost photos, hassles, idiocy. Never again, Patriot. Never.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: After reading several mixed reviews I decided to buy this battery. Came incredibly fast in the mail and was packaged very nicely. The paperwork that came with it concerning product description/instructions was written in laughably horrible english, barely even comprehendable. And as far as the battery itself is concerned, it definitly looked new. It's a little larger then the standard dv6000 battery, so it does stick out a little bit making your laptop not sit flush against a table top (not a big issue.) The battery took a couple of hours to charge each time I charged it and got roughly 6 hours of full on gaming time with it. The issue I do have with this battery is I litearlly only got about 4 days out of it. 4th day I had it just shut down while I was using it. Won't start off the battery now and will not charge. I never once charged the laptop with it on, and I've always made sure to drain the battery before charging it to insure it keeps its maximum battery life. When the battery is in and AC cord is plugged in, Windows states it's charging but always remains at 24% life. I have tried several different AC power cords to charge it aswell to no effect. I really was hoping this battery would be fine despite the bad reviews I've read and that maybe people where just getting fluke batteries, but that doesn't seem to be the case. Looks nice, came fast, ran nice and long when it did run, but in the end I'm cutting my loss at the 13$ I spent on this battery. It's not even worth bothering sending it back due to the shipping costs.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: This device is supposed to allow one to use Dropbox as the source and the Passport device as the target for backups. In other words, one should be able to back up files from Dropbox directly to the device. After struggling for several hours to make this work and getting nothing but error messages, I called tech support. They suggested I first download the contents of my Dropbox to my computer and then back up from there to the device. I was certain I must have misheard. Nope, the tech person admitted that the Dropbox-to-device function simply does not work--even though the product's description and the manual say it does. Needless to say, I'm outraged and am returning this product.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
Works great as a gaming keyboard. It's not mechanical, but I'm not spending that much on a keyboard either.

Back-lighting is nice. A quick glance down is all I need in order to find where I need to be.

I haven't seen any signs of latency. I can press multiple keys at the same time and they all register (example: 1234). Good enough, right?

The keys have a good amount of resistance, and they're quiet. They are also spaced well.

I like the wrist rest. My hands hurt most of the time and the rest on the keyboard helps with some of the discomfort in my hands and wrists. I could easily add a bigger rest to it without it being awkward or dysfunctional.

For the money, this board is a great deal. I'm happy with the purchase. I'll update if anything goes wrong, but for now it's an excellent product.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: Looks professional is of great quality... Impressed

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
Though many have complained that this case 'looks ugly', I can only assume that statement comes from those who favor a more minimalist-friendly design. If you are looking for something awesome, with great access to HDDs and the ability to turn heads, this is the case for you. If you are thinking of naming your system after a Germanic, Greek, or Egyptian deity, this is the case for you.

Well structured, but I could see the paint being scrapped easily. Still, this case looks great, has a good deal of space (plenty of room for my Radeon R9 270x), and is sturdy enough to pass my initial review. I have no complaints, I enjoy looking at this box while it's running. It's a bit of a distraction :)

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
perfect fit, it took me a little while to figure out exaxtly what to physical demensions were on my laptop,
the "demensions" are what you need when purchasing an adapter, NOT the model # of the Lap Top.
as in The outside of your existing plug is 5.5 mm / & the inner hole accepts a 2.5 mm pin (drill bit)
I used drill bits to calculate the size of my adapter / & 1mm=0.039 inch / 1/16 inch = 0.062 thousanthsinch / 3/32 = about 0.095 thousanths
so, 2mm = about 0.089 thousanths inch, a little under 3/32 Inch drill bit

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: I have a pair of these in SLI on a full size ATX INTEL motherboard I installed in an HP DC7600CMT case (i5-3470). I run triple Samsung monitors and have absolutely NOTHING bad to say about them. The download from the included cd is quite extensive though. If you install these singly or as an SLI pair, you can go to NVIDIA and up grade the programs. By using two cards instead of a more than double the cost single graphics card, I've kinda future proofed my graphics. Now the 700 series is out. Granted the 600 series are 192 bit graphics versus the 256 bit 700 series, but from viewing other gamers 780s, I can't see anything different in picture quality. BUT, that might have to do with my Samsung monitors. I'm not an authority on this, but, I can tell you what MY eyes see. Flight simulators ARE graphics intense, and I have ZERO issues to relate to you. Two of these are still a hundred or more less than a single higher powered card. Purchase a pair and give them a run for the money. I think you'll enjoy them....

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
I tend to overshop for my computer equipment. After studying ZyXEL as a company and this particular unit, AND relying on Amazon's product pictures, I gladly bought this unit. Unfortunately, this is one of my purchases which truly deserves a one-star rating.

One of the Amazon product pictures showed this unit as having 4-pin DSL connection. That feature immediately put this unit high on my list of possible purchases, because I wanted a 4-pin connection to give me the best performance with my high speed service. When the unit arrived it had only a 2-pin connection. I don't believe that Amazon was trying to deceive anyone by using this picture, but I made my purchase largely because of this inaccurate picture.

The product arrived DOA. These things happen with computer equipment, but I needed a modem right away when I bought this one. I chose to go to the local WalMart, where I bought an Actiontec unit which fit my needs but also has a 2-pin connection.

Amazon was great, as always, on my return of this unit. They accepted it back without question and without the original packaging. They provided the postage to ship it back, and promptly credited my credit card when they received it.

I don't like to give one-star ratings, as most products have some value. However, because of the incorrect and misleading (aka deceptive) picture, I effectively bought something I didn't want which also turned out to not work at all.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: True to color and good quality. Love love love!

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
This keyboard has several design flaws which I will outline here.

1. Amount of force needed to press the keys is too high. This causes the user to pound the keys.

2. Keyboard seems to miss double leters effectively. Probably caused by #1 above. >>>Notice that I left a letter out of 'letters' in the sentence before. That was not on purpose!<<< I hit 'l' two times, but only got one. Hapens al the time unless I POUND the double letters intentionally. And again, the missed leters here ('Hapens', 'al') are hapening naturally.

3. The keyboard is very loud and clacky as another reviewer mentioned. Probably caused by #1 above. I sit near a person at work that uses this keyboard and it is LOUD. She said her fingers have gotten stronger since using this keyboard, probably because she has to pound the keys. I'm actually considering buying her another keyboard out of my own pocket... Here at home, as I type this, I'm two rooms away from my sleeping wife, and I'm actually wondering if my typing will wake her up.

4. They keys are recessed in a flush enclosure that has a rigid rim around the base of the keys. If you accidentally hit the edge of the left shift key for example, you'll hit the rigid edge, which is at the same elevation, and miss the shift. This is the first such keyboard I've ever used with this design peculiarity. I now know why keyboard keys should be raised instead of recessed into a flush case.

On a positive note, it looks good. So if you are going for looks only, this is the keyboard for you.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
I have now had 2 of these. The first one became corrupt within a month, but only after I had moved 3 years worth of my photography to it and saved family records dating back to the 1530s on it. Lost forever. Western Digital had me mail it in for data retrieval only to tell me later that it was impossible because of encryption that was military grade. They sent me a new one with no apology for the priceless records that I could never get back again.

During the next year I used the new one to store any new photos I took. Then I was injured in a car accident and didn't take any for a year, but continued to store documents on my WDMP. After under 2 years that drive also became corrupted and I once again lost everything; this time that included every paper I wrote for school for 2 years.

I would not recommend this product to anyone, not even an enemy. It will cause you heartache and grief and you will never be able to recover whatever is lost because of it. The company don't care for their customers at all. The sooner people learn to quit giving their money to such a dishonest company the sooner we can put them out of business and no longer have to worry about them.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: I was a bit worried thatt I would miss holding the book and feeling the paper, but actually I would rather read on the Kindle.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
Unfortunately, I bought this device before learning online that it is slow, poorly designed, and extremely expensive compared to ANY other product on the market. (I now have a generic device that is tiny, twice the speed and performance, and less than half the cost.) I bought it from Best Buy, and SADLY did not get the Best Buy extended warranty. (Always get the Best Buy extended warranty.) I am currently a month outside of the Best Buy warranty, but have 9 days to go on the Lyncsys warranty, which allows refunds and returns for up to 90 days. Except Linksys/Belkin won't honor it. I heard various explanations for this--they had to ask Best Buy and *they* said no, there isn't a warranty unless I bought it directly from Lyncsys/Belkin, all they can do is replace it. They are replacing the slow, poorly designed, and extremely expensive device with another slow, poorly designed, and extremely expensive device, and that is their response to my request that they actually do what they promised.
I've had probably 10 Lyncsys or Belkin products in the past, which all worked very well. I don't know why this one is an aberration, or if my customer service experience is an aberration. I will soon have a new, in-box Lyncsys WUSB6300, which I won't use, and a deeply dissatisfying and disheartening opinion of Lyncsys and Belkin as businesses, which I will use to guide my future purchases.
